title.narrative: Ethiopia General Education Quality Improvement Project II

description.narrative: The higher order objective for the eight years' program is ‘Improving the quality of General Education (Grades 1-12) throughout thecountry’.The specific PDO for GEQIP II is ‘Improving learning conditions in primary and secondary schools and strengthening of institutions at different levels of educational administration’.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education, Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
Ministry of Finance and Economic Cooperation, Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plans and training plans. Schedule 2, Section I, E, 4 of the Grant A | Description :The Recipientshall appoint not later than three (3) months after the effective date, adopt the first annual work plan and the first trainingplan all in form and substance satisfactory to the World Bank. | Due Date :31-Oct-2017

Finance Agreement :Procurement Auditor. Schedule 2, Section I, B (i) of the Grant Agreement | Description :The Recipient shallappoint not later than six (6) months after the effective date, and thereafter maintain at all times during implementation of theproject, a procurement auditor, to carry out an annual independent procurement audit of the project, in form and substancesatisfactory to the Word Bank. | Due Date :31-Jan-2018

Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Adoption of a Project Implementation Manual (PIM), including guidelines relatingto School Grants, satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :20-Mar-2014
Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Adoption of the first Annual Training Plan, satisfactory to the Association | DueDate :18-Apr-2014
Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Adoption of the first Annual Work Program, satisfactory to the Association | DueDate :18-Apr-2014
Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Adoption of the first Procurement Plan satisfactory to the Association | Due Date:18-Apr-2014
Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Adoption of the second Annual Work Plan, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation | Due Date :31-May-2014

Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Appointment of staff and consultants, with qualifications, experience and terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association, including one staff and or consultant each in the areas of education planning,monitoring & evaluation, procurement, and financial management in the MoE, and one in the area of financial management in theMoFEC, and one accountant and procurement officer each in all regions | Due Date: 18-Mar-2014

Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description :Recipient shall ensure timely implementation of any measures referred to in theSocial Assessment, as relevant to Project beneficiaries, including, more vulnerable and disadvantaged groups and Projectsbeneficiaries in emerging regions, in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement: Dated Covenant | Description: Recipient will carry out jointly with the Association and the ContributingPartners a mid-term review, which shall cover:(i) overall progress in the implementation of the Project in meeting the objectivesof the GEQIP Program; and (ii) the results of the monitoring and evaluation activities, as measured against the performanceindicators | Due Date :07-Jul-2016

Finance Agreement: Legal Covenant | Description :Recipient shall carry out an audit of School Grants under Part 3 (b) of theProject, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association, and furnish a report of said audit to the Association not laterthan six months after the end of the period to which said audit relates. | Frequency :Yearly
